content: Before Starting Gradle Groovy DSL plugins { id "io.spring.dependency-management" version "1.0.6.RELEASE" } repositories { jcenter() maven { url "https://dl.bintray.com/stachu540/GlitchLib" } } dependencyManagement { imports { mavenBom "io.glitchlib:glitch-BOM:$glitch_version" } } dependencies { compile "io.glitchlib:glitch-core" compile "io.glitchlib:glitch-kraken" } Kotlin DSL plugins { id("io.spring.dependency-management") version "1.0.6.RELEASE" } repositories { jcenter() maven("https://dl.bintray.com/stachu540/GlitchLib") } configure<DependencyManagementExtension> { imports { mavenBom("io.glitchlib:glitch-BOM:$glitch_version") } } dependencies { compile("io.glitchlib:glitch-core") compile("io.glitchlib:glitch-kraken") } Maven <dependencyManagement> <dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>io.glitchlib</groupId> <artifactId>glitch-BOM</artifactId> <version>${glitch.version}</version> <type>pom</type> <scope>import</scope> </dependency> </dependencies> </dependencyManagement> <dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>io.glitchlib</groupId> <artifactId>glitch-core</artifactId> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>io.glitchlib</groupId> <artifactId>glitch-kraken</artifactId> </dependency> </dependencies>
title: Netbeans Setup

content: Importing Gradle Groovy DSL plugins { id "io.spring.dependency-management" version "1.0.6.RELEASE" } repositories { jcenter() maven { url "https://dl.bintray.com/stachu540/GlitchLib" } } dependencyManagement { imports { mavenBom "io.glitchlib:glitch-BOM:$glitch_version" } } dependencies { compile "io.glitchlib:glitch-core" compile "io.glitchlib:glitch-kraken" } Kotlin DSL plugins { id("io.spring.dependency-management") version "1.0.6.RELEASE" } repositories { jcenter() maven("https://dl.bintray.com/stachu540/GlitchLib") } configure<DependencyManagementExtension> { imports { mavenBom("io.glitchlib:glitch-BOM:$glitch_version") } } dependencies { compile("io.glitchlib:glitch-core") compile("io.glitchlib:glitch-kraken") } Maven <dependencyManagement> <dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>io.glitchlib</groupId> <artifactId>glitch-BOM</artifactId> <version>${glitch.version}</version> <type>pom</type> <scope>import</scope> </dependency> </dependencies> </dependencyManagement> <dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>io.glitchlib</groupId> <artifactId>glitch-core</artifactId> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>io.glitchlib</groupId> <artifactId>glitch-kraken</artifactId> </dependency> </dependencies>
title: Eclipse Setup

content:
Before Starting Before start we need a download some tools to using our IDE.
Download Java Development Kit (JDK) Install it and configure environmental variables: JAVA_HOME if not exist, create and adding to PATH - $JAVA_HOME/bin.
 JDK8. JDK10. JDK11.  Integrated Development Environment (IDE) IntelliJ IDEA is a special programming environment or Integrated Development Environment (IDE) largely meant for Java. This environment is used especially for the development of programs. It is developed by a company called JetBrains, which was formally called IntelliJ. It is available in two editions: the Community Edition which is licensed by Apache 2.0, and a commercial edition known as the Ultimate Edition. Both of them can be used for creating software which can be sold. What makes IntelliJ IDEA so different from its counterparts is its ease of use, flexibility and its solid design.
 Editions Comparison Download  Setup  Launch IDE Create New Project [File > New > Project] Select Gradle Make sure if you select Project SDK to 1.8 or greater Click Next Enter a GroupId (e.g. com.github.yourname)
 You can choose whatever you want
 Enter a ArtifactId (e.g. bot)
 You can choose whatever you want
title: IntelliJ Setup

content:
Introduction Welcome to the Glitch wiki! You can find all important threads on the right side of the page.
Download / Installation We shall recommend use a build managers, like a Gradle or Maven.
If you don’t have familiar with those build managers, you can follow on the setup guides or download Glitch directly via Bintray repository
Dependency Gradle - Groovy DSL plugins { id "io.spring.dependency-management" version "1.0.6.RELEASE" } repositories { jcenter() maven { url "https://dl.bintray.com/stachu540/GlitchLib" } } dependencyManagement { imports { mavenBom "io.glitchlib:glitch-BOM:$glitch_version" } } dependencies { compile "io.glitchlib:glitch-core" compile "io.glitchlib:glitch-kraken" } Gradle - Kotlin DSL plugins { id("io.spring.dependency-management") version "1.0.6.RELEASE" } repositories { jcenter() maven("https://dl.bintray.com/stachu540/GlitchLib") } configure<DependencyManagementExtension> { imports { mavenBom("io.glitchlib:glitch-BOM:$glitch_version") } } dependencies { compile("io.glitchlib:glitch-core") compile("io.glitchlib:glitch-kraken") } Maven <repositories> <repository> <id>GlitchLib</id> <url>https://dl.bintray.com/stachu540/GlitchLib</url> </repository> </repositories> <dependencyManagement> <dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>io.glitchlib</groupId> <artifactId>glitch-BOM</artifactId> <version>${glitch.version}</version> <type>pom</type> <scope>import</scope> </dependency> </dependencies> </dependencyManagement> <dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>io.glitchlib</groupId> <artifactId>glitch-core</artifactId> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>io.glitchlib</groupId> <artifactId>glitch-kraken</artifactId> </dependency> </dependencies> IDE Setup If youâ€™ve never used Gradle or Maven before, you should take a look at the setup tutorial:
 IntelliJ (recommended) Eclipse Netbeans  Support Glitch and Twitch API Discord’s is an excellent place if you have questions about the library.
Examples We will deliver it ASAP.
title: Welcome
